articles.title: Cambodians pay tribute to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Exchange of greetings with Malaysia 
    Pyongyang, July 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, exchanged messages of greetings with Tuanku Syed Sirajuddin Ibni al-Marhum Tuanku Syed Putra Jamalullail, King of Malaysia, on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Malaysia.
 Kim Yong Nam in the message of greetings on June 30 expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries which have developed on good terms since the establishment of diplomatic relations would grow stronger in different domains and sincerely wished the king good health and happiness as well as the people of Malaysia prosperity and well-being.    
 The King of Malaysia in the message of greetings on June 26 hoped that the close relations between the two countries would further strengthen in the future.

articles.title: Memorial services for Kim Il Sung held abroad
articles.content:
Cambodians pay tribute to Kim Il Sung 
    Pyongyang, July 13 (KCNA) -- The Funcinpec Party of Cambodia sent a basket of flowers to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh to commemorate the ninth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's demise
 Rum Chieng, head of the party delegation visited the embassy on July 8. He laid the floral basket before a portrait of the president there and paid tribute to him.    
 The head of the delegation said that the funcinpec party always remembers the deep solicitude shown by the president for King Norodom Sihanouk and itself. The party wholeheartedly wishes leader Kim Jong Il good health and greater success in the noble cause of national defence and reunification, he added.

articles.content:
Repression of trade union protested in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 13 (KCNA) -- The railway workers union called a press conference on July 8 in protest against the authorities' repression of the strikers, according to MBC of South Korea.
 On July 7, the national railroad administration announced that it would take disciplinary actions, such as suspension of duties or more, against all those unionists involved in the strike and file a claim for damage, charging that 87 percent of them failed to observe the term of returning to work.    
 The union told at the conference that the "government" calling for "return to work first, negotiation next" refuses to have dialogue but cracks down upon the unionists though they went back to work after the general strike.

Architectural festival to be held
    Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The third "May 21 Architectural Festival" will take place here late in July.
 The festival will include a prize contest for designing monumental edifices to be built to thoroughly implement the tasks set forth in leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "Theory of Architectural Art" and a grandiose plan of the Workers' Party of Korea, an exhibition of blueprints for constructing city and county seats as required by the new century, a national symposium on architecture and construction and national lectures on the modernization of architectural designing and other events.
